instruction: Predict the possible outcome of the given scenario.
input: A large corporation implements a new customer loyalty program.
output: The possible outcome of this scenario is that customer loyalty and satisfaction could increase. This could lead to more repeat customers, more referrals, more sales, and more revenue for the corporation. However, it could also lead to increased costs in order to maintain the loyalty program. In the end, the success of the program will depend on the amount of customer engagement and satisfaction it is able to generate.
